tweet: On the final day of #BlackHistoryMonth, we honor past fighters on the front lines of equal rights. Thanks to their efforts, we have been able to witness many happy firsts, from President Obama to Virginia Beach's own Gabby Douglas. Let's never stop striving for a better America.

90% of Americans favor expanded background checks for gun purchases. 96% of background checks are done within 3 business days. #HR1112 would give the FBI more time to finish the remaining 4% of background checks to help ensure guns don’t fall into criminal hands. #EndGunViolence

This week I joined Democrats and Republicans in voting for a bipartisan #PublicLands package:

✅ 1.3 million acres of new wilderness 
✅ Protects 1 million acres of public lands from mining
✅ Permanently reauthorizes #LWCF
✅ Saves taxpayers $9 million https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/26/climate/public-lands-conservation.html?rref=collection%2Fbyline%2Fcoral-davenport …

America needs commonsense laws that help keep guns out of the hands of criminals. Universal background checks benefit our country and communities. I am a proud cosponsor of The Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019 and will be voting for it today. #HR8 #EndGunViolence

Every American who is concerned for the future of our democracy should stand up and say this is not right – and not the will of the people. This is a dangerous precedent and must be stopped.

I took an oath, both during my 20 years in the Navy and now in Congress, to support and defend the Constitution. This unconstitutional action by the President will steal from military readiness in response to something that is not a true national emergency.
Democrats and Republicans in Congress have shown a willingness to work together to defend our border, as we were elected to do. This cannot be supplanted by unilateral executive action.

In February 1944, the Navy commissioned its first African-American officers. The 12 commissioned officers, plus a warrant officer who received his rank at the same time, came to be known as The Golden Thirteen. #BlackHistoryMonth  https://www.history.navy.mil/our-collections/photography/us-people/m/martin-graham-e.html …

I ask Governor Northam to resign. This isn’t about politics, this is about what is right and wrong.

We need leaders who will bring us together instead of driving us apart. While it was proper for Governor Northam to apologize, there is no excuse for this type of photograph then or now. Unfortunately, the existence of this photograph does not bring us together.
